original: Block, Anders Benjamin, teol. lic., fil. kand., kyrkoherde, Göteborg, f. 29/ 10/89 i Örby, Älvsb. 1., av kontr :prost Herder B. o. frih:an Cecilia Sparre. G. 31 m. Anna Norborg. Barn: Eskil f. 32, Karin 34, Per 35, Ceciha 37, Hans 40. — Stud:ex. 07, teol. kand. i Lund 10, fil. kand. 14, teol. lic. 19, prästv. i Gbg 17. Kyrkoadj. i Oscar Fredriks förs. i Gbg 21, kommin. 23, kyrkoh. i Haga förs. i Gbg sed. 32. Ordf. i Gbgs stifts miss :råd 32, in;s’p. v. Sigr. Rude-becks sk. o. Gbgs gymn. f. fl. 35, Skr.: Minnen fr. gamla prästhem i Gbgs stift (29). LNO.
translated: Block, Anders Benjamin, licentiate of theology, bachelor of arts, pastor, Gothenburg, born October 29, 1889 in Örby, Älvsborg County, son of district dean Herder B. and Baroness Cecilia Sparre. Married to Anna Norborg in 1931. Children: Eskil born in 1932, Karin in 1934, Per in 1935, Cecilia in 1937, and Hans in 1940. Block graduated from high school in 1907, received a Bachelor's degree in theology in Lund in 1910, a Bachelor's degree in arts in 1914, and a licentiate of theology degree in 1919. Ordained as a priest in Gothenburg in 1917. Served as a church assistant in Oscar Fredrik parish in Gothenburg from 1921, a curate from 1923, and a pastor in Haga parish in Gothenburg since 1932. Chairman of the Gothenburg diocese's missionary council since 1932, inspector of Sigtuna Folk High School and several high schools in Gothenburg in 1935. Author of "Memories from old rectories in the Gothenburg diocese" (1929). Member of the Royal Society of Northern Antiquaries.

structured.name: Anders Benjamin Block
structured.description: Anders Benjamin Block was a Swedish pastor and author known for his work as chairman of the Gothenburg diocese's missionary council and his book, "Memories from old rectories in the Gothenburg diocese."
